org.valid4j

Class Validation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.valid4j.Validation

  • public class Validation
extends Object
    Entry point for validation methods. Use these methods to throw recoverable exceptions if validation fails. Recoverable exceptions are exceptions that a correct program can and should catch and recover from. (Recoverable exceptions may be checked or unchecked.)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <X extends Exception> 
      void      		 validate(boolean condition, X exception)
      Validate the boolean expression that is supposed to be true.
      static <T,X extends Exception> 
      T      		 validate(T o, org.hamcrest.Matcher<?> matcher, X exception)
      Validate the given object that is supposed to satisfy the matcher.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public static <X extends Exception> void validate(boolean condition,
                                  X exception)
                     throws X extends Exception
        Validate the boolean expression that is supposed to be true. If not, a recoverable exception will be thrown that the client is supposed to catch and recover from.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition to validate. Supposed to be true.
        exception - the recoverable exception to be thrown if validation fails.
        Throws:
        X - the recoverable exception, if validation fails
        X extends Exception

      • validate

        public static <T,X extends Exception> T validate(T o,
                                 org.hamcrest.Matcher<?> matcher,
                                 X exception)
                  throws X extends Exception
        Validate the given object that is supposed to satisfy the matcher. If not, a recoverable exception will be thrown that the client is supposed to catch and recover from.
        Parameters:
        o - the object to validate
        matcher - the matcher that the object must satisfy
        exception - the recoverable exception to be thrown if validation fails.
        Returns:
        the validated object, if valid
        Throws:
        X - the recoverable exception, if validation fails
        X extends Exception
